intro: Polypodium dissimulans, commonly known as the hidden fern, is a species of epiphytic fern native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often growing on tree trunks or rocks. The plant has long, arching fronds with a distinctive, serrated leaf margin. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the fronds, and it reproduces through spore dispersal rather than seeds. Due to its delicate nature, it requires careful handling and specific environmental conditions to flourish.
